colorScale.legendDescription: Share of population living with less than 3.10$ per day

note: This data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Share of population living with less than $2.15 and $3.65 per day
subtitle: Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day. The poverty line of $3.65 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty adopted in lower-middle-income countries. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in living costs between countries.
